Operations.description: A list of operations that are part of the batch.

items.description: Represents the output of a BatchWrite operation.

AddFacetToObject.description: A batch operation that adds a facet to an object.

ObjectAttributeList.description: The attributes to set on the object.

items.description: The combination of an attribute key and an attribute value.

FacetName.description: The name of the facet that the attribute exists within.

SchemaArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the schema that contains the facet and attribute.

ObjectReference.description: A reference to the object being mutated.

Selector.description:
A path selector supports easy selection of an object by the parent/child links leading to it from the directory root. Use the link names from each parent/child link to construct the path. Path selectors start with a slash (/) and link names are separated by slashes. For more information about paths, see Access Objects. You can identify an object in one of the following ways:

  • $ObjectIdentifier - An object identifier is an opaque string provided by Amazon Cloud Directory. When creating objects, the system will provide you with the identifier of the created object. An object’s identifier is immutable and no two objects will ever share the same object identifier

  • /some/path - Identifies the object based on path

  • #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call

SchemaFacet.description: Represents the facet being added to the object.

SchemaArn.description: The ARN of the schema that contains the facet with no minor component. See arns and In-Place Schema Upgrade for a description of when to provide minor versions.

ChildReference.description: The child object reference that is to be attached to the object.

  • /some/path - Identifies the object based on path

AttachPolicy.description: Attaches a policy object to a regular object. An object can have a limited number of attached policies.

ObjectReference.description: The reference that identifies the object to which the policy will be attached.

PolicyReference.description: The reference that is associated with the policy object.

AttachToIndex.description: Attaches the specified object to the specified index.

IndexReference.description: A reference to the index that you are attaching the object to.

AttachTypedLink.description: Attaches a typed link to a specified source and target object. For more information, see Typed Links.

Attributes.description: A set of attributes that are associated with the typed link.

items.description: Identifies the attribute name and value for a typed link.

AttributeName.description: The attribute name of the typed link.

Value.description: The value for the typed link.

SourceObjectReference.description: Identifies the source object that the typed link will attach to.

TypedLinkFacet.description: Identifies the typed link facet that is associated with the typed link.

SchemaArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the schema. For more information, see arns.

TypedLinkName.description: The unique name of the typed link facet.

CreateIndex.description: Creates an index object. See Indexing and search for more information.

BatchReferenceName.description: The batch reference name. See Transaction Support for more information.

IsUnique.description: Indicates whether the attribute that is being indexed has unique values or not.

LinkName.description: The name of the link between the parent object and the index object.

OrderedIndexedAttributeList.description: Specifies the attributes that should be indexed on. Currently only a single attribute is supported.

items.description: A unique identifier for an attribute.

FacetName.description: The name of the facet that the attribute exists within.

SchemaArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the schema that contains the facet and attribute.

ParentReference.description: A reference to the parent object that contains the index object.

Selector.description:
A path selector supports easy selection of an object by the parent/child links leading to it from the directory root. Use the link names from each parent/child link to construct the path. BatchReferenceName.description: The batch reference name. See Transaction Support for more information.

ObjectAttributeList.description: An attribute map, which contains an attribute ARN as the key and attribute value as the map value.

items.description: The combination of an attribute key and an attribute value.

FacetName.description: The name of the facet that the attribute exists within.

SchemaArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the schema that contains the facet and attribute.

ParentReference.description: If specified, the parent reference to which this object will be attached.

RemoveFacetFromObject.description: A batch operation that removes a facet from an object.

ObjectReference.description: A reference to the object whose facet will be removed.

SchemaFacet.description: The facet to remove from the object.

SchemaArn.description: The ARN of the schema that contains the facet with no minor component. See arns and In-Place Schema Upgrade for a description of when to provide minor versions.

items.description: Structure that contains attribute update information.

AttributeAction.description: The action to perform as part of the attribute update.

AttributeActionType.description: A type that can be either UPDATE_OR_CREATE or DELETE.

AttributeUpdateValue.description: The value that you want to update to.

AttributeKey.description: The key of the attribute being updated.

FacetName.description: The name of the facet that the attribute exists within.

SchemaArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the schema that contains the facet and attribute.

TypedLinkSpecifier.description: Allows a typed link specifier to be accepted as input.

IdentityAttributeValues.description: Identifies the attribute value to update.

items.description: Identifies the attribute name and value for a typed link.
